description: A Square temple near Buckingham, beside the river Twin, opposite the Thornborough Roman barrows. interestingly, we know that the walls were made of timber. Lewis (1966) suggest a mid to late 3rd CE start date and an the early 5th CE for it's end.
bibliography: Green. “The Religions of Civilian Roman Britain,” 1976.
Green, Charles. “A ROMANO-CELTIC TEMPLE AT BOURTON GROUNDS, BUCKINGHAM,” 1965.
Johnson, AE. “Excavations at Bourton Grounds, Thornborough 1972-3,” 1975.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Bourton Grounds Temple (Buckinghamshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Wilson, Nigel. “The Thornborough Romano-British Temple: A Reappraisal,” 2017.
